alert.note: Alert for Hartford; Middlesex (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 20 at 9:24PM EST until further notice by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Connecticut...Massachusetts...New Hampshire...Rhode Island... Connecticut River At Hartford affecting Hartford and Middlesex Counties. Connecticut River At Thompsonville affecting Hampden and Hartford Counties. Connecticut River At Northampton affecting Hampden and Hampshire Counties. Connecticut River At Middle Haddam affecting Middlesex County. Farmington River At Simsbury affecting Hartford County. Nashua River At East Pepperell affecting Hillsborough, Middlesex and Worcester Counties. Assabet River At Maynard affecting Middlesex and Worcester Counties. Sudbury River At Saxonville affecting Middlesex County. Concord River At Lowell affecting Middlesex County. Shawsheen River At Andover affecting Essex County. Charles River At Dover affecting Norfolk and Middlesex Counties. Pawtuxet River At Cranston affecting Kent and Providence Counties. Pawcatuck River At Westerly affecting Washington and New London Counties. Wood River At Hope Valley affecting Washington County. For the Connecticut River...including Hartford, Northampton, Thompsonville, Middle Haddam...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Farmington River...including Simsbury...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Nashua River...including East Pepperell...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Concord River...including Lowell...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Shawsheen River...including Andover...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Charles River...including Dover...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Pawtuxet River...including Cranston...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Pawcatuck River...including Westerly...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Wood River...including Hope Valley...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Connecticut River at Hartford. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Flooding affects some residential areas below Hartford through Rocky Hill, including some roadways. Upstream of Hartford, flooding is likely to affect Windsor Locks, East Windsor and Windsor. Should localized evacuations be necessary, act quickly. Further downstream flooding will likely result in the evacuation of low lying area along River Road in Cromwell and Meadow Road in Portland. Flooding increases from Middletown and Portland to the river mouth at Old Saybrook. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:31 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 21.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 16.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:31 PM EST Wednesday was 21.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 21.8 feet late this evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.7 feet on 04/20/1863. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 1000 AM EST.
